articles.content:
National fine art exhibition opens 
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The national fine art exhibition "Let the great general's immortal feats in external activities shine long in history" opened with due ceremony.
 Displayed are over 40 pieces of fine art works reflecting the Korean people's deepest thanks and fervent loyalty to leader Kim Jong Il who had a successful 20,000 km-odd-long journey of over 20 days with a noble mission for the patriotic cause of the Korean people, the development of the DPRK-Russia friendly relations and the global independence.   
 Among them are Korean painting "the great sun of the world people" and posters "great auspicious event of the Korean people" and "let us defend with arms the great general's exploits in external activities"  minister of culture Kang Nung Su made an opening address at the ceremony held at the Pyongyang International House of Culture yesterday.

articles.content:
Korean folksong art festival held in Uzbekistan
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The 8th Korean Folksong Art Festival was held in Tashkent on August 26 with the attendance of 12 Korean art troupes under the United Confederation of Koreans in the Uzbek Republic.
 At the festival speakers stressed that the festival following the 2001 grand festival for national reunification in homeland would be a continuation of the grand festival for reunification.    
 Put on the stage were "Kimjongilia," "dear general, where are you?" and "don't advance, night of Pyongyang" and other Korean songs and dances.

U.S. aerial espionage against DPRK
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists committed over 150 cases of aerial espionage against the DPRK with all types of strategic and tactical reconnaissance planes involved in august, according to military sources.

articles.title: Warmongers hit for projected war huddle
articles.content:
Demonstration before U.S. tank drill ground
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- South Korean people held a fierce demonstration for more than an hour at the entrance to the U.S. tank drill ground in Jangpha-ri, Phaphyong-myon, Phaju city, Kyonggi Province, blocking the tank movement, on August 28, according to the South Korean newspaper Hangyore.
 They strongly demanded the U.S. military make an open apology for announcing on august 16 the U.S. troops "will not be responsible for killing people by tanks" and take a measure for preventing damage caused by noise.

articles.content:
Greetings to first vice-President of Iran
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Mohammad Reza Aref upon his appointment as first vice-President of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
 Believing that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further expand and develop in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished him success in his responsible work.
